Rich,
    I don't know if this will help but here it goes.  Akasaka TADAYOSHI, Kofu 
ju, Omi Province, ca. 1800-25  He worked in the Akasaka style.  Maybe 
Tatsutoshi is a student or another Akasaka smith that worked alongside Tadayoshi at 
that time frame in this area.  I know you seem to like Akasaka tsuba, is this 
piece Akasaka in style?  Do you think you could post a picture?  I checked all 
my books and could not find your smith directly, but this TADAYOSHI might be a 
step in the right direction.  

Lou
